Description: Attack Flow Detector is an open-source tool designed to help SOC teams detect coordinated, multi-stage attacks hiding in a sea of false positives and disjointed alerts. It maps logs and alerts to MITRE ATT&CK Techniques using explainable NLP models, clusters them into contextualized "attack steps" with temporal and spatial logic, and then sequences them into full attack chains using Markovian and graph-based models. It outputs human-readable tickets: FP (false positive), Incident, and full Attack Stories. No black-box AI or LLMsâ€”just explainable, scalable logic designed for real-world SOC pipelines.
